sentences.en: He tried to juxtapose the photos of his girlfriend on the desk to show his love.
sentences.cn: 他把女朋友的照片在桌上加以并列以表示他的爱.

sentences.en: The technique Mr Wilson uses most often is to juxtapose things for dramatic effect.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊先生最常用的手法是将事物放在一起，以产生戏剧化的效果。

sentences.en: The technique Mr. Wilson uses most often is to juxtapose things for dramatic effect.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊先生最常用的技巧是把事物并列起来以获得戏剧性效果。

sentences.en: We tried to juxtapose the sculptures to give the best effect.
sentences.cn: 我们把雕刻品加以并排以得到最好的效果.

sentences.en: When you juxtapose the two, you can see the difference.
sentences.cn: 要是你把这两个人并在一起, 就看得出分别来了.

trans.tran_en: to put things together, especially things that are not normally together, in order to compare them or to make something new

trans.tran_cn: 把…并列，把…并置，把…放在另一个旁边
